title: Bitcoin Wakes Up and Rolls Out Of Bed
text:
Volatility on had been uncharacteristically tame these past few sessions. Yet, anyone sleeping behind the wheel would have been caught off-guard midway through Asia as prices spiked lower.

The retrospective driver is yet to surface, although the Japanese yen had strengthened while yields fell around the same time, in turn causing the US10-JP10 year differential narrow and drag down with it accordingly. This would be an interesting development if the two are related, as it suggests traders are cashing out of upon the signs of risk-off, which again brings into question Bitcoins safe-haven status.

Still, the sell-off was not limited to as all major coins are down for the session. Yet, despite the sell-off, is the least effected for the session, trading down just -3.1% compared with Amun Ripple's (SIX: ) -7.3% at the time of writing. Still, as we highlighted yesterday, altcoins were approaching key levels of resistance so we’re not too surprised to see traders booking profits. Yet in the case of Bitcoin, it’s nearing levels which could make or break it.

Bitcoin Wakes Up and Rolls Out Of Bed
description: Market Analysis by Matt Simpson covering: USD/JPY, BTC/USD, ETH/USD, Amun Ripple. Read Matt Simpson's Market Analysis on Investing.com CA.
